body_html:
@juliusshufan
Hi I did as you did:

  1. downloaded the same data-set and
  2. I installed official PyTorch v0.3 via conda, by command "conda install pytorch-cpu torchvision -c pytorch",
  3. set OMP_NUM_THREADS=4

It takes me double the time:

Reading lines...
Read 145437 sentence pairs
Trimmed to 11318 sentence pairs
Counting words...
Counted words:
fra 4589
eng 2988
['tu es fort effronte .', 'you re very forward .']
6m 28s (- 90m 42s) (5000 6%) 2.9297
13m 6s (- 85m 9s) (10000 13%) 2.3578
19m 43s (- 78m 54s) (15000 20%) 2.0613
26m 17s (- 72m 18s) (20000 26%) 1.8068
32m 48s (- 65m 37s) (25000 33%) 1.6223
38m 58s (- 58m 27s) (30000 40%) 1.4049
44m 22s (- 50m 42s) (35000 46%) 1.3244
49m 46s (- 43m 33s) (40000 53%) 1.1715
55m 15s (- 36m 50s) (45000 60%) 1.0675
60m 35s (- 30m 17s) (50000 66%) 0.9961
65m 57s (- 23m 58s) (55000 73%) 0.9050
71m 23s (- 17m 50s) (60000 80%) 0.8221
76m 55s (- 11m 50s) (65000 86%) 0.7823
82m 24s (- 5m 53s) (70000 93%) 0.7406
87m 42s (- 0m 0s) (75000 100%) 0.6467

@juliusshufan
Hi I did as you did:

downloaded the same data-set and
I installed official PyTorch v0.3 via conda, by command "conda install pytorch-cpu torchvision -c pytorch",
set OMP_NUM_THREADS=4

body:
@juliusshufan 
Hi I did as you did:
1. downloaded the same data-set and
2. I installed official PyTorch v0.3 via conda, by command "conda install pytorch-cpu torchvision -c pytorch", 
3. set OMP_NUM_THREADS=4

It takes me double the time:

Reading lines...
Read 145437 sentence pairs
Trimmed to 11318 sentence pairs
Counting words...
Counted words:
fra 4589
eng 2988
['tu es fort effronte .', 'you re very forward .']
6m 28s (- 90m 42s) (5000 6%) 2.9297
13m 6s (- 85m 9s) (10000 13%) 2.3578
19m 43s (- 78m 54s) (15000 20%) 2.0613
26m 17s (- 72m 18s) (20000 26%) 1.8068
